column3: It's too bad blk ppl always claim they quit things because they see no one who looks like them doing it. The culture needs more individuality. In terms of the European sport of cycling, its not rocket science as to why its not appealed to a culture that lacks individuality.
It‚Äôs amazing just how much positivity they bring out of most people. I mean, just read these comments. It‚Äôs so unusual to find a comment section on the internet so positive.
Really enjoyed the video, fun to see guys and girls who love each other and love racing their bikes.
this is not pro cycling this is the new era of free and encouraging criterium style racing
LOVE, LOVE, LOVE every single aspect of LEGION and the shake up they have been brave enough to ignite within the sport...AMEN. Nic, Sunshine Coast, AUSTRALIA
cycling is no different than thing else, stay relevant and get your worth. and there are many paths and ways to find success especially today. you dont even need to win races to get noticed

There is nothing new that Legion team is introducing. Much like football ‚öΩ,  cycling is already one most diverse sports. Don't let current negative media dictate the temperature of society.

The Americans just love boring race formats, going round in circles. Whether it be Nascar or crit racing. I'll stick to the good old fashioned European cycling calendar of the 5 monuments and 3 grand tours. Tradition trumps whatever this is in my book.

Great Doc! Thank you for making this for us and sharing it with us - inspiring! I definitely want to put some hard sessions in my legs to lift my game! Legion - Winning For Life!
Anyone else came here to watch this and anticipating for 2022 years video?

Yeah, you guys are amazing bike racers, but we all know that what you're doing is way bigger than that.  To remove the elitism that exists in the cycling community, to give poc heroes to look up to, to be inspired by, is what it's all about.  I know it sounds hokey, but it truly is a matter of you have to see it to be it.  Maybe 15 or 20 years from now those two little girls will be racing for the US in the Olympics, or winning grand tours, or maybe they'll be the national crit champions...but even if they just love riding bikes, that will be awesome.  I love it, and hopefully you guys will be in FL some day and you'll organize a big group ride where we can all come out and share some time on the road with you and your amazing team.  Until then, keep inspiring, keep winning, and keep loving.
Good to see diversity in cycling, real competition!

The fan interaction at 14ish minutes was so awesome. A top of the heap rider taking time to talk to a young rider but in an honest way with care and interest even asking the young rider to come find her later to talk about her race. We need more of that. I know a lot of the riders at the top right now are like this Travis McCabe, Justin and Corey, and Peter Stetina are also like this. We need every cyclist to be like this from Justin Williams down to that roadie at their local crit. Open and approachable.
